intro: Alpinia suishaensis, commonly known as the Sichuan ginger, is a rhizomatous herb native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, leafy stems and clusters of fragrant, pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Alpinia suishaensis make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and pharmacological research.
